actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on January 13, 2026.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Crawford moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 345
actions-list.actionItem: 45 (Roll no. 15).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 6504 — "To extend duty-free treatment provided with respect to imports from Haiti under the Caribbean Basin Economic Recovery Act, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 340
actions-list.actionItem: 54 (Roll no. 14).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 6500 — "To extend duty-free treatment provided with respect to imports from certain countries in Africa under the African Growth and Opportunity Act, to extend customs user fees, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 369
actions-list.actionItem: 22 (Roll no. 13).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 2683 — "To provide for control of remote access of items under the Export Control Reform Act of 2018."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend the rules, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 6:30 P.M. today.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6504.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 6504 — "To extend duty-free treatment provided with respect to imports from Haiti under the Caribbean Basin Economic Recovery Act, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6500.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 6500 — "To extend duty-free treatment provided with respect to imports from certain countries in Africa under the African Growth and Opportunity Act, to extend customs user fees, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 269.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 269 — "To improve coordination between Federal and State agencies and the Do Not Pay working system."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6732.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Biggs (AZ) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 6732 — "To prohibit unlawful coercion of a minor, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6715.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Harris (NC) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 6715 — "To prohibit sexual exploitation and sexually explicit depictions of minors, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6719.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Ms. Lee (FL) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 6719 — "To prohibit threats to a minor, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3424.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Cline moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3424 — "To amend titles 11 and 28, United States Code, to modify the compensation payable to trustees serving in cases under chapter 7 of title 11, United States Code, to extend the term of certain temporary offices of bankruptcy judges, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 909.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Wagner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 909 — "To temporarily provide additional deposits into the Crime Victims Fund."
The Chair announced the Speaker's designation, pursuant to clause 7(a)(1) of rule 15, of H.R. 909 as the measure on the Consensus Calendar to be considered this week.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2683.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Lawler moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2683 — "To provide for control of remote access of items under the Export Control Reform Act of 2018."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable David J. Taylor to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
